intro: Platostoma siamense, commonly known as the Siam flat lichen, is a species of lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga, and a fungal partner from the Ascomycota division. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks and rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its structure and chemical composition make it an important indicator species for assessing environmental conditions.
